intro: Anisocampium skinneri, commonly known as Skinner's anisocampium, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are small and typically yellow or white, arranged in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
